benchmark_details.name: Anno-lexical
benchmark_details.overview: This study introduces Anno-lexical, the first large-scale dataset for media bias classification with over 48,000 synthetically annotated examples, created to investigate the viability of using Large Language Models for annotations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a cost-effective, high-quality dataset for training classifiers in media bias detection using LLMs.

data.source: Synthetic annotations generated by LLMs based on carefully selected prompts and human-labeled examples.
data.annotation: Synthesized by Large Language Models using majority vote among multiple LLM annotators.

methodology.calculation: MCC is calculated based on the confusion matrix for binary classification tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher MCC values indicate better performance in correctly classifying lexical bias.
methodology.validation: Comparative testing against human-annotated models and evaluation on established bias benchmark datasets.
